metadata.title: CVE-2022-27775 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
An information disclosure vulnerability exists in curl 7.65.0 to 7.82.0 are vulnerable that by using an IPv6 address that was in the connection pool but with a different zone id it could reuse a connection instead.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2022-27775` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.1
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.1
libcurl3-nss - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.1
libcurl4 - 7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

notes.note: mdeslaur> per upstream, curl 7.65.0 to and including 7.82.0 leosilva> bionic is 7.58.0 and xenial 7.47.0, so not affected. trusty/esm is 7.35.0, so not affected.

criterions.comment: curl package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.74.0-1.3ubuntu2.1').
